node.title: Tasmania has been racing to the 80pc fully vaccinated target. Will it cross the finish line today?
node.description: In September, Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein declared the state was in a race to reach 80 per cent fully vaccinated against COVID by Melbourne Cup day. Is the state likely to reach that milestone today?
node.content:
["During a press conference in September, Tasmanian Premier Peter Gutwein declared the state was in a race\u00a0to vaccinate against COVID-19,\u00a0as outbreaks of the Delta variant continued to spread across New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT.\u00a0", "At the time, Tasmania was coming to the end of its six-week COVID vaccination blitz, and Mr Gutwein set a target of November 2 to reach the vaccination milestone of 80 per cent.", "\"This is a race, and we want to use that day as\u00a0the date that we target 80 per cent vaccination, Melbourne Cup Day, the day that the country stops for a race,\" Mr Gutwein\u00a0said on September 17.", "Since firing the starting gun at that press conference,\u00a0Tasmania has recorded two COVID cases in the community, the south of the state has experienced a snap three-day lockdown, and the state government has set a date to reopen to the rest of mainland Australia \u2014 all the while expanding its vaccine rollout.", "Now, 46 days since the target was set,\u00a0just how far away is Tasmania from reaching that vaccination milestone?", "", "
Tasmania had been aiming to reach the 80 per cent fully vaccinated milestone by Melbourne Cup day.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "
We're still a little way off 80 per cent
", "On Sunday, Health Minister Jeremy Rockliff said 74.5 per cent of the state's population aged 16 and over had\u00a0received both doses of the vaccine, while 89 per cent had\u00a0received a first dose.", "At the time, Mr Rockliff said he expected the state to reach the 90 per cent first-dose milestone either later that day or on\u00a0Monday.", "But\u00a0data\u00a0released by the federal Health Department showed the state falling just short, with 89.3 per cent of people having received one dose by Sunday.", "The federal data also showed\u00a0Tasmania had reached 75.1 per cent fully vaccinated, 13\u00a0days after reaching the 70 per cent milestone.", "The data also provides a breakdown of doses by\u00a0Local Government Areas (LGAs).", "So, which areas are leading the race to 80 per cent?", "Before we dive a little deeper into the figures shown in this map, there are\u00a0a few things to note.", "Firstly, there are some parts of the state that are omitted from the map. Flinders Island, King Island, Glamorgan-Spring Bay and the West Coast aren't included due to their population sizes, so they have been greyed out \u2014 but their figures are included in the broader state's numbers.", "Secondly, this data is only taking into account vaccinations that have been administered up to 11:59pm on October 31, so any jabs that were given in the state yesterday (Monday)\u00a0won't be included.", "And despite people aged 12 and over being eligible to be vaccinated in Tasmania, the federal\u00a0data by LGA includes those aged 15\u00a0and over \u2014 even though the state's current target is based on the vaccination rate of those 16 and over.", "", "
The Derwent Valley local government area, which includes New Norfolk, has one of the lowest COVID vaccination rates in Tasmania.(Facebook: Michelle Dracoulis)
", "
Where are we leading, and where are we falling short?
", "It's not too surprising to see that the LGAs of Hobart City, Kingborough and Clarence are all sitting well over 80 per cent fully vaccinated.", "All three of these areas either have dedicated vaccination hubs or are in close proximity to one, and more than 95 per cent of their population aged 15\u00a0and over\u00a0have received a first dose.", "Glenorchy in Hobart's northern suburbs is also well on its way to reaching the 80 per cent milestone in the coming days. It's\u00a0the only other LGA in Tasmania to have a first-dose rate of more than 95 per cent, and has increased its second dose rate by 4\u00a0per cent in the past week.", "In the north of the state, Launceston is the fifth-most vaccinated LGA in Tasmania, with close to 77 per cent of the regional city fully immunised against COVID.", "Nearby, West Tamar is likely to be the next council area to hit the 80 per cent milestone. It\u00a0is currently sitting just shy of\u00a078 per cent double dosed, and only reached 70 per cent a fortnight ago.", "But as we move away from the major population centres of Hobart and Launceston, the percentage of people fully vaccinated against COVID begins to reduce.", "Interestingly, some of the lowest vaccination rates in the state are found in areas neighbouring those which have the highest rates.", "The Derwent Valley, for example, has the fourth-lowest second dose rate in the state,\u00a0but is next door to Glenorchy, which has one of the highest.", "The LGA of Kentish, which includes the towns of Sheffield, Railton and Wilmot, has the second-lowest vaccination rate in the north and north-west, despite being sandwiched between areas of higher vaccination rates.", "Currently\u00a0the Central Highlands is the area lagging behind the most in Tasmania. In\u00a0fact, it has consistently had some of the lowest rates since the federal Health Department began to release vaccination data by these specific areas in August.\u00a0", "Given its isolation from major vaccination hubs in the state, its lower vaccination rates are unsurprising. And positive signs are there, with the area having doubled its second dose rate from 26.3 per cent since August 28.", "The latest data shows the local government areas of Circular Head and Kentish are the only areas yet to reach 80 per cent when it comes to first doses.", "Last Friday, state Health secretary Kathrine Morgan-Wicks identified some key areas of interest when it comes to lifting the vaccination rate.", "\"We are continuing to hold state-run Pfizer clinics across northern Tasmania and the rest of the state.\"\u00a0", "", "
What you need to know about Tasmania's COVID border reopening plan.
", "
How are we\u00a0tackling lagging vaccination rates?
", "The state government has been acutely aware that vaccinating regional Tasmania would be the most challenging part of the vaccination rollout, which began earlier this year.\u00a0", "The ABC's COVID-19 vaccination tracker forecasts Tasmania will reach the 80 per cent fully vaccinated milestone on November 14, and will hit 90 per cent by December 8 \u2014 one week before the state reopens to COVID hotspots.", "When asked about the state failing to meet the Melbourne Cup day target, a spokesperson from the state government directed the ABC to the Health Department, who then pointed to\u00a0comments made by Mr Gutwein at a press conference last Friday.", "Mr Gutwein told the media \"we're on target\", but also said he expected it would still be another seven to 10\u00a0days before hitting 80 per cent fully vaccinated.", "\"The only thing that's stopping us from landing in or around Melbourne Cup is going to be the timing associated with the three different types of vaccines that we have and the time to have your second dose,\" he said.", "Last Friday, in anticipation for borders reopening next month, Mr Gutwein said\u00a0the 90 per cent target by December 1 was still achievable.\u00a0", "\"Our target is for 90 per cent of all eligible Tasmanians over the age of 12 to have received their vaccination and our current path would indicate that we will achieve that for the over-16s by around December 1 and for the 12 to 15 cohort by around the December 4 or 5,\" he said.\u00a0", "", "
Vaccination hubs, like this one in Moonah, are key to the state reaching its 80 per cent target.(ABC News: Maren Preuss)
", "Along with the pop-up clinics, a COVID-19 vaccination bus service has been travelling to rural and remote parts of Tasmania, and walk-in vaccination hubs were held at Bunnings stores in Burnie, Devonport and Invermay over the weekend.\u00a0", "Pharmacies and GP clinics across the state are also able to deliver both the Pfizer and Moderna vaccines.\u00a0", "Despite the state missing the initial 80 per cent\u00a0target deadline, Tasmania remains on track to reach its 90 per cent target before it reopens to the mainland.", "But based on current data, some regions of the state are likely to reach that milestone faster than others.\u00a0", "", "
COVID-19 boosters to begin as early as November 8
"]
